reviewText: Age of Enigma is a decent casual collection of diverse minigames/puzzles connected by a linear ghost story. It took me ~3 hours. The game resolution is fixed at 1024x768 (fullscreen or windowed).\n\nThere are casual" and "adventure" modes
date: I played the latter and still found it fairly casual. The game's decent
votesHelpful: the shadow guy may be a little below par. I couldn't find anything outstanding about this game
votesTotal: either positively or negatively. It is no hidden object game
votesFunny: but in many respects similar to one.\n\nIt's ok if you like that sort of thing and can pick it up cheaply (I got it in a bundle)
column16: I wouldn't recommend it. If you're looking for a casual puzzle game with excellent art and writing
column17: check out Puzzle Agent instead - it's better
column19: and funnier (and also a little mysterious and scary). If you want to be truly amazed by a casual puzzle game

reviewText:
Odd little hidden object game, though it is not hidden object in the traditional sense in having a list of names of objects for which to find.  Rather, there are items that need to be constructed at various times, such as finding the six pieces of a spear to give to a ghost.  It is almost a point & click game, but while there is definitely pointing and clicking, it is more along the lines of what you typically see in hidden object games that have additional puzzles.  For instance, there you might be asked to match pieces of fresco to where they fit in the scene, or count the number of cubes in a set of blocks.

You do have to collect objects and assemble them, but unlike most point & click games, you are pretty much told exactly what to do, and there is little doubt most of the time as to what to do next.  If you have any doubt, you can go to your handy guide which has a list of current tasks, in case you are totally brain dead, and you can click a question in which the answer will show that pretty much explicitly tells you exactly what is needed to be done to complete the task.  It's unusual to see what amounts to a hint guide (to this extent) built into a game, but this game seems to be designed for a ten year old who might get confused at times.

While the artwork is hand drawn, it is not animated as one might normally expect, but rather you might see a dog running as being indicated as five individual drawings of the dog shown one after the other superimposed on top of the scene.  Or another example is when the screen shakes a little to indicate an earthquake.  This lack of animation hinders the game at times, since it can be quite distracting.

This game reminded me a little of the hidden object game Mirror Mysteries

http://store.steampowered.com/app/291630/

but unlike that game which I felt compelled to finish to the end, I started to find this game quite tedious after finishing with the first ghost given that it holds your hand the whole way and the puzzles and hidden objects (such as they are) present little challenge.

So is this game worth $10?  Definitely not.  Is it worth perhaps a buck or as part of a bundle (which is how I got it)?  Only if you have a kid who has never played this kind of game before and needs a helping hand.

reviewText:
Short version: 68%Age of Enigma is a collection of simple puzzles of little variety, put into an equally repetitive storyline about six ghosts and their incredibly short tales.

Long version:Age of Enigma: The Secret of the Sixth Ghost is a mostly forgotten smartphone game of a mostly forgotten French independent studio. Like most of its kind, it is extremely short and overpriced.

The game mechanics are similar to a hidden object game, only there are no hidden object scenes: you just gather obviously placed items from the rooms then use them to access very simple, childish puzzles, which quickly start repeating themselves, especially in the fifth chapter.

The story is about a young woman who is lured into a mansion (what else?) to help six ghosts. All six stages consist of a quick one-room segment where you gain the trust of the ghosts, then a 3-4 screen part where you solve their riddle. It is very straightforward, very simple, but mostly nothing but an excuse to draw some pretty backgrounds.

reviewText: Firts of all, it's a point&click adventure rather than a HOG. Graphics are OK, mini games and puzzles are easy. Sounds and music are average. You are a young woman (as usual. Thanks Artifex Mundi) who has special abilities on ghosts. There is a mysterious ghost, who asks for your help and wants to help you. You must help and free six ghosts in a building. But beware, the danger is always nearer than you expect. My rating for this game is 6/10 because the puzzles are weak, the scenario is not polished enough, and the end-- such a bad ending. It is still worth to purchase, especially in sales or bundles but don't expect so much.

reviewText:
6.2/10 - Middle of the Road Point and Click

This took me 3.6 hours to finish. Not bad for a game such as this. I'd say the story was the worst part. Freeing 6 ghosts.. blah blah. Voice acting isn't bad, puzzles are diverse and sometimes hard. Cut-scenes and graphics are a touch above average.

Worth $2-3 - Not $10

reviewText: Is an OK game and can be bought for a dollar.\nStory is kind of weak and the end is some disappointing but the puzzle make worth it anyway. playtime is around 1,5-2 hours

It is a nice looking hidden objects game. Story is OK. What I did not like is: no resolutions (only fullscreen and window), does not remember settings between launches (starts in fullscreen with loud music).

From the start this game feels extremely childish. Overly simple art style and the story is... bad. Just bad. I will give most HoG a good try before posting a negative review, couldn't even make myslef play through an hour of this. If you have actually played a decent amount of HoG's before I would recommend giving this one a miss. Not worth it.

reviewText: The game is quite sort, the story is mediocore. The minigames are fun, some short, some needs oberservation and thinking,  and you can play them after you found them and successfully solved them once. You can skip your way through the minigames when you just want to enjoy the story. To have a good evening, buy it when its on sale :)
